decks.notes: The deck focuses on using a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan. It utilizes cards like Solitude and Fatal Push for removal, Thoughtseize for hand disruption, and Ephemerate for additional value. The deck also includes creatures with powerful abilities like Flickerwisp and Overlord of the Balemurk to control the board. Finally, it aims to lock down the opponent with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Witch Enchanter, while also providing a steady stream of threats with creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Emperor of Bones.

The main concept of this Ruby Storm deck is to quickly generate mana using cards like Ruby Medallion, Manamorphose, Pyretic Ritual, and Desperate Ritual to cast spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Past in Flames and Wish to recur key spells and find necessary pieces. Overall, the deck aims to combo off and win the game by overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of spells and damage.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to quickly overwhelm opponents. It also includes various spells and enchantments to control the board and protect your creatures. The deck incorporates mana acceleration and efficient removal to maintain pressure and disrupt opponents' strategies. By leveraging aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to quickly close out games by overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of powerful attacks.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also removing threats on the board with Fatal Push and Kozilek's Command. The deck aims to apply pressure early with aggressive creatures like Nethergoyf and Emperor of Bones, supported by cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Orcish Bowmasters. It also includes utility lands like Ifnir Deadlands and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth to support its aggressive game plan. The deck focuses on maintaining tempo and controlling the board to secure victory.

The central idea of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a combination of efficient threats and disruptive spells. By generating mana through Birthing Ritual and Leyline Binding, you can quickly deploy powerful creatures like Elesh Norn, Omnath, and Magmatic Hellkite. The inclusion of countermagic like Force of Negation and removal spells like Solitude allows you to protect your threats and disrupt your opponent's game plan. With a mix of creatures, spells, and lands that cover all five colors of Magic, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and maintain control of the game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays, backed up by burn spells and powerful enchantments. With cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast damage output. Utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, the deck can control the battlefield and finish off opponents quickly. The inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional support and protection for the aggressive creatures. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly through aggressive plays and burn damage.

This deck focuses on applying early pressure with aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize. The deck also utilizes flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to generate value from enter-the-battlefield abilities and protect key creatures. Teferi, Time Raveler helps control the tempo of the game, while cards like Solitude and Prismatic Ending provide versatile removal options. The deck aims to apply pressure, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and control the board to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to maintain control of the battlefield through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also utilizes disruptive spells like Orim's Chant and Day's Undoing to disrupt opponents' strategies. With a mix of control elements, card advantage, and versatile removal options, this deck aims to outlast opponents and establish a dominant board presence in the late game.

The deck aims to use cascade cards like Shardless Agent to cast Living End from the graveyard, allowing the player to put a large number of creatures onto the battlefield at once while also disrupting the opponent's board. By cycling creatures like Street Wraith and Generous Ent, the deck can manipulate its graveyard to set up the perfect Living End. Force of Negation and Subtlety provide some protection and disruption, while Endurance can be used to exile key cards from the opponent's graveyard. This deck is all about explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to use instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Faithful Mending to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand into play quickly. By combining reanimation with control elements like Force of Negation and removal spells, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent while setting up a game-winning combo. Atraxa, Grand Unifier serves as a backup plan to generate value and slow down the opponent. Overall, the deck's strategy is to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with Eldrazi Temple and Utopia Sprawl to play big Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also includes control elements like Malevolent Rumble and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to disrupt the opponent's board state. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells while controlling the game through removal and disruption.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful and efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Scion of Draco, and Territorial Kavu to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial to control the board and protect its creatures. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help boost creature power while providing utility. Arena of Glory provides additional card advantage while Consign to Memory can help deal with problematic threats. The deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and secure a fast victory.

This deck revolves around quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures while utilizing disruptive cards to slow down their game plan. By combining fast creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and efficient removal like Fatal Push, the deck aims to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total. Cards like Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional disruption and protection, while Ephemerate and Ocelot Pride generate card advantage and tempo. The deck's synergy and versatility allow it to adapt to different matchups and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The deck utilizes creatures with various abilities to create a toolbox of options, allowing for flexibility and adaptability in different situations. It focuses on utilizing synergies between creatures and spells to generate value and establish a strong board presence. By tutoring for specific creatures with Chord of Calling and assembling key pieces of the combo, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victory. The mix of creature abilities, mana acceleration, and recursion ensures that the deck can consistently execute its game plan and outmaneuver opponents.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays combined with burn spells to control the board and finish the game quickly. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures with efficient mana costs and powerful abilities, while using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way for attacks or finish off the opponent. Blood Moon can disrupt opponents' mana bases, while Ajani and Voice of Victory provide additional ways to push through damage and protect your creatures.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies and disrupting opponent's plays using specific cards. It aims to control the board while applying pressure through creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk. It also utilizes cards like Ephemerate and Teferi, Time Raveler to manipulate the battlefield and protect its creatures. Thoughtseize and Fatal Push are included for disruption and removal, while Quantum Riddler and Witch Enchanter provide additional card advantage. The deck includes a mix of lands to support its color requirements and ensure consistency in playing its threats and disruptive spells.
